It discusses various applications of the Geoportal, including Bhuvan-MGNREGA. The Geoportal provides tools and resources for users to explore and analyze geospatial data. Some of the important points are that the Geoportal includes data from satellites, hydrology, and infrastructure. Users can also add their own layers of data.

This is an article about the Indian Space Research Organisation’s (ISRO) Geoportal. It discusses geospatial data and its applications. The article also provides links to tools and resources for using the Geoportal. Some of the important points are that the Geoportal is a gateway to Indian Earth Observation data and that it provides tools for viewing and analyzing this data.

Bhuvan, the geospatial platform developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), has seen significant developments recently. Notable releases include the Overview Training 2024, Flood Inundation data at the Godavari and Sabari confluence, and the ISRO Geosphere-Biosphere Programme providing Above Ground Biomass(AGB) data. The introduction of Pocket Bhuvan with voice-guided navigation and Explore Bhuvan 2D 2.0 enhances user experience. Additionally, the platform highlights its commitment to environmental monitoring with initiatives like the First Census of water bodies under the Irrigation Census scheme and the release of Night Time Light (NTL) portal and Atlas for exploring decadal changes in night time light over India from space (2012-2021). Bhuvan also extends its reach with applications like MyBhuvan, Bhuvan -Timelapse, and AET Product on Bhuvan NHP Portal. The inclusion of Urban Water Body Information System visualization further underscores its utility. Collaborative applications offer a platform for sharing data and creating governance applications. Various Bhuvan versions, including 2D, 3D, Lite, Open Data Archive, Climate & Environment, and Bhoonidhi VISTA, cater to diverse user needs.

Contains a list of all available Bhuvan APIs that can be freely used by the public. Some of these APIs are village geocoding, village reverse geocoding, various LULC statistics, shortest path API,ellipsoid to geoid conversion API. All of these APIs are freely available once the user has keys or tokens after logging in with their account or making a new one for the Bhuvan portal

The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs is actively engaged in the Housing for All initiative, also known as PMAY. Upon logging in, users are welcomed with a prompt to enter either the city name or latitude and longitude coordinates. The available tools include the Field Data Viewer, facilitating access to crucial information. Users can filter data by state, district, and city, ensuring a comprehensive view of housing-related details nationwide. The Image Gallery provides a visual representation of relevant data. The option to search by beneficiary ID offers a targeted approach to retrieving specific information. The interface design allows users to toggle the left panel for a cleaner view. With a geographic scope of 500 km on Bhuvan, the platform empowers users to access and analyze significant housing and urban affairs data efficiently.

The A.P. State Housing Corporation provides a user-friendly interface upon login, prompting users to input city names or latitude and longitude coordinates. The available tools include the Field Data Viewer, facilitating efficient access to relevant information. Users can filter data based on district, mandal, village, observer ID, and specific project stages. The option to search by beneficiary ID allows for targeted inquiries. The platform also features Base Admin and Base Hydrology sections for comprehensive data management. With a geographic scope of 100 km on Bhuvan, users can analyze housing-related data efficiently. The Discussion Forum and Contact options provide avenues for communication and support. Toggling the left panel allows for a customized view of the interface. The platform emphasizes user engagement and accessibility, ensuring a seamless experience for individuals involved in housing-related initiatives.

The "Search Hospital" feature allows users to find healthcare facilities by entering a city name or latitude and longitude coordinates, with the option to set a proximity range in kilometers. The user can customize the search profile by selecting "All" for a comprehensive view. Additionally, the scheme filter ensures that users can specifically target healthcare facilities associated with a particular scheme. State-wise hospital information is available, and users can easily get directions and assess proximity to the desired healthcare institutions. The Bhuvan platform enhances the accessibility of healthcare-related data, offering a user-friendly interface for efficient navigation and exploration.

The page you linked to appears to be a discussion forum called Bhuvan Discussion Forum, but there are currently no forums on the board. It seems the forum is not very active, with the most users ever online being 36 on December 20, 2018. As of right now, there are only 2 users online, 1 registered and 1 guest.

This article whisks you away on a voyage through India's watery landscape, courtesy of the National Remote Sensing Centre's Water Bodies Information System (WBIS). Dive into an ocean of data – over 82,000 reservoirs, lakes, and their ilk – meticulously categorized by size and tracked from satellite gaze across the years. Witness the dynamic pulse of these vital resources with live water levels and area comparisons, revealing the shrinking whispers of Himalayan glaciers or the sudden monsoon symphony that replenishes thirsty plains. From the colossal 115 major reservoirs, their names etched like ancient giants, to the countless whispers of smaller water bodies, WBIS becomes your personal cartographer. Unfurl this interactive map, trace the veins of India's watery lifeblood, and discover the fascinating depths of this precious resource, one pixel at a time.
This is a planner tool for BHUVAN Website. It uses Central Authentication Services and Single Sign In Options to login and use the features.

This website is about 3D Globe and 3D spatial navigation. This interactive globe viewer lets you explore continents, oceans, and even landmarks. Overlay data layers like maps, roads, or buildings for a deeper look. Measure distances, map routes, and discover hidden insights through the information tool. All this, without downloads or plugins, on most devices. Bhuvan 3D: your personal portal to Earth's fascinating geography.

The Ministry of Human Resource Development offers a login interface where users can input city names or latitude and longitude coordinates to access relevant information. The available tools include links, manuals, and access to college details. Specifically, the "Institutions (Funded by RUSA)" section provides a systematic approach to retrieve data. Users can choose attributes such as the state (Andhra Pradesh, in this case) and specify operations like "Equal to (=)". The platform supports further query expressions related to NR Census, Census (2011), and the Field Data Viewer, enhancing the depth of available information. With a geographic scope of 500 km on Bhuvan, the platform facilitates comprehensive data exploration. Additional features like the Discussion Forum, Send Mail, Legend, and Contact options contribute to user engagement and support. The platform serves as a valuable resource for accessing and analyzing data related to institutions funded by RUSA.

Bhuvan's Geographical Indications platform showcases India's unique products linked to specific regions, like Darjeeling tea or Kanjivaram silk. Explore a searchable database across various categories like food, handicrafts, and textiles. Uncover details like the product's history, location, and unique characteristics, empowering consumers to identify genuine items and celebrate India's rich cultural heritage.

The Distribution of Flycatchers feature on Bhuvan enables users to explore information based on specific attributes. By entering a city name or latitude and longitude coordinates, users can focus on a particular flycatcher species, such as the "Black-and-Orange Flycatcher." The platform utilizes common names as attributes and offers query expressions to refine searches. It's important to note that the information is derived from the Handbook of the Birds of India and Pakistan, maintaining the species names used by Salim Ali. The available map views include Map, Satellite, Hybrid, and Terrain, enhancing the visualization of flycatcher distribution. With a geographic scope of 500 km on Bhuvan, users can gain insights into the habitat and range of these bird species.
The Discussion Forum, Send Mail, Legend, and Contact options contribute to user engagement, providing a comprehensive tool for bird enthusiasts and researchers interested in flycatcher distribution.

The Ministry of Education, under the Department of School Education & Literacy, presents School Bhuvan - NCERT, an e-learning portal designed to provide map-based learning experiences for students. The portal aims to raise awareness about the country's natural resources, environment, and their role in sustainable development. Offering various levels of exploration, including Level1, Level2, and Level3, students can engage in creating points, lines, and polygons with attributes related to political, agricultural, water, soil, minerals, and climate aspects. The portal also offers e-learning courses in Remote Sensing and Geospatial Technologies. The Help section provides materials for School Bhuvan - NCERT, including downloads related to specific mapping projects and educational content. Bhuvan, described as the gateway to Indian Earth Observation Data Products & Services, is highlighted as a Geoportal of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO). This Earth browser allows users to explore and discover virtual earth in 2D, 2.5D, and 3D space, with a specific focus on the Indian region. The platform showcases ISRO's satellite imaging capabilities in a multi-sensor, multi-platform, and multi-temporal domain. The exploration of Bhuvan serves as a valuable resource for accessing Indian Earth Observation data, enhancing students' understanding of geographical concepts. The copyright for Bhuvan is attributed to ISRO, dated 2014.
This is the webpage for monitoring of NABARD Watershed projects using geospatial technology but it is currently under maintainance

peering down from satellites on India's watersheds, tracking how forests grow, rivers swell, and projects unfold. This web-based tool uses real-time data to show land cover changes, water levels in reservoirs, and the progress of crucial conservation efforts. Overlay maps, zoom in on details, and even generate reports to share with others. Bhuvan IWMP isn't just a map; it's a collaborative hub for informed decisions and sustainable water management across India. Dive in and become a steward of our precious resource!

Bhuvan Tourism goes beyond the typical travel guide, offering a dynamic and interactive experience fueled by satellite insights and community contributions. From planning the perfect adventure to uncovering hidden wonders, Bhuvan Tourism is your essential companion for exploring the diverse and captivating landscape of India. So, pack your bags, download the app, and let Bhuvan Tourism guide you on an unforgettable journey through the heart of India.

Bhuvan Himachal Pradesh Forest is a web platform dedicated to exploring and understanding the forests of Himachal Pradesh, India. Developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), it offers a wealth of information and tools for: Forest Exploration
Interactive Maps: Navigate detailed maps with various layers like satellite imagery, forest cover, administrative boundaries, and infrastructure networks.
Know Your Forest: Find detailed information about specific forest areas, including tree species, topography, and wildlife.
Live Fire Locations: Monitor real-time forest fire locations and historical trends.
Forest Management:
Asset Management: Track important assets like beat boundaries, wildlife sanctuaries, and plantations.
Climate Vulnerability: Assess the vulnerability of different forest areas to climate change.
Forest Fire Regimes: Analyze historical fire data to understand fire patterns and risk zones.
Additional Features:
My Layers: Upload your own data layers for personalized analysis.
Discussion Forum: Connect with other users and share insights about Himachal Pradesh forests.
Download Data: Access and download various forest-related data sets.

Bhuvan Disaster Services provides a comprehensive overview of natural disasters in India. Explore real-time maps of floods, cyclones, landslides, earthquakes, forest fires, and droughts. Track affected areas, monitor water levels, and access detailed reports for informed decision-making and disaster preparedness. Dive into historical data to understand trends and patterns, empowering individuals and organizations to build resilience against nature's wrath.

Bhuvan Thematic Services offers a platform to explore and analyze thematic data crucial for understanding India's land use, environment, and development. Visualize and access detailed information on land cover, wastelands, geomorphology, flood hazards, water bodies, and urban sprawl through interactive maps and downloadable datasets. This empowers users in diverse fields to study environmental changes, plan infrastructure, and manage resources effectively.

Bhuvan's IMD Weather Products section provides a platform for users to access weather-related information. Upon logging in, users are welcomed with tools like links and a home button. The primary feature, "Spatial Distribution of Weather Parameters," allows users to select the product frequency. Unfortunately, specific details about the available frequencies are not provided in the given paragraph. The platform emphasizes metadata view and offers technical documents for further insights. With a geographic scope of 500 km on Bhuvan, users can explore the spatial distribution of weather parameters using data from Indian Remote Sensing Satellites. The platform also facilitates user interaction through the Discussion Forum, Send Mail, and Contact options. While the paragraph introduces the Bhuvan-IMD Weather Products, more specific information about the available products and their frequencies would be needed for a comprehensive summary.

The Department of Agriculture, Cooperation, and Farmers Welfare is actively implementing the Geo-tagging of assets under the "Per Drop More Crop" (PDMC) component of the Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY) using Geospatial Technologies. Launched on July 1, 2015, PMKSY aims to achieve the convergence of investments in irrigation at the field level. Its key objectives include expanding cultivable areas under assured irrigation, improving on-farm water use efficiency to minimize water wastage, and promoting the adoption of precision-irrigation and other water-saving technologies. The project signifies a shift towards sustainable and efficient water management practices, reflected in its re-christening as Per Drop More Crop. The initiative utilizes Bhuvan and NRSC (National Remote Sensing Centre) platforms, providing a user manual for guidance. The different login roles, such as Administrator, State Moderator, and District Moderator, indicate a structured approach to project management. Users can engage in discussions through the Discussion Forum and seek assistance via the Contact option, emphasizing collaboration and communication within the initiative.

The Hot Weather Outlook feature on Bhuvan offers users the ability to visualize hot weather conditions. Upon logging in, users can access tools such as links and a home button. The primary tool, "Hot Weather Visualization," allows users to explore and understand the spatial distribution of hot weather. Unfortunately, specific details about the visualization parameters or frequency are not provided in the given paragraph. The platform leverages Indian Remote Sensing Satellites to enhance the understanding of hot weather patterns. With a geographic scope of 1000 km on Bhuvan, users can gain insights into the extensive coverage of hot weather conditions. The platform also encourages user interaction through the Discussion Forum, Send Mail, and Contact options, fostering engagement and support within the Bhuvan community.

Bhuvan Ganga, dedicated to supporting the National Mission for Clean Ganga, offers geospatial tools and information to enhance environmental management along the Ganges River. Users can log in and access features like administrative boundaries at the state, district, taluk, village, and panchayat levels, aiding in comprehensive planning. The platform provides tools for drainage analysis, identifying pollution sources, monitoring water quality, and understanding utilities and treatment plants. Project-related information, national parks, sanctuaries, and monitoring locations are also accessible. Users can query village statistics and explore features such as the Ganga Flood Plain, overlaying various data layers for detailed analysis. The inclusion of 3D views, Varanasi Ghats, Kumbh Mela-2013, and a mobile app download option showcases the platform's diverse capabilities. Bhuvan Ganga utilizes data from Indian Remote Sensing Satellites, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information. The Discussion Forum, Send Mail, and Contact options promote user engagement and support within the Bhuvan community.

Explore Telangana's forests like a ranger with Bhuvan! Navigate detailed maps layered with satellite imagery, boundaries, and even plantations. Track real-time fire locations and analyze historical trends. Monitor important assets like wildlife sanctuaries and beat boundaries. Assess climate vulnerability and understand past fire patterns to protect these vital resources. Bhuvan empowers everyone, from nature enthusiasts to forest officers, to explore, understand, and manage Telangana's forests responsibly.

Bhuvan Punjab Forest is a web platform dedicated to exploring and managing the forests of Punjab, India. Dive into detailed maps with layers like satellite imagery, forest cover, and infrastructure. Monitor real-time fire locations and historical trends. Track crucial assets like wildlife sanctuaries and plantations. Analyze climate vulnerability and historical fire patterns to protect this vital resource. Bhuvan empowers everyone, from nature enthusiasts to forest officers, to explore, understand, and manage Punjab's forests responsibly.

This website tells about the Weather Climate Models and Weather Climate Environement Modelled Products like Surface Temperature, Surface Wind Speed, Rainfall, Total Totals Index, K Index, Relative Humidity. We just need to enter the date and the results will come.

Bhuvan Karnataka Forest is a web platform dedicated to exploring and managing the forests of Karnataka, India. It offers interactive maps with layers like satellite imagery, forest cover, administrative boundaries, and infrastructure. Key features include: Live Fire Monitoring: Track real-time forest fire locations and their historical trends. Forest Asset Management: Track important assets like wildlife sanctuaries, plantations, and beat boundaries. Climate Vulnerability Assessment: Assess the vulnerability of different forest areas to climate change. Forest Fire Regime Analysis: Analyze historical fire data to understand fire patterns and identify risk zones. Discussion Forum: Connect with other users and share insights about Karnataka's forests. Downloadable Data: Access and download various forest-related datasets for further analysis. Bhuvan Karnataka Forest caters to a diverse audience, from nature enthusiasts to forest officers and researchers.

Bhuvan's Haryana viewer lets you explore this Indian state through interactive maps. Overlay satellite imagery, boundaries, and natural features like districts, cities, and villages. Gain deeper insights with data layers like population density, land cover, and water bodies. Uncover historical census details and points of interest like monuments and protected areas. Bhuvan: your window to vibrant Haryana's diverse landscape.

Bhuvan Saraswati delves into the mystery of the ancient Saraswati River in India. Explore interactive maps showcasing its path through satellite imagery, palaeochannels, and archaeological sites. Access detailed information on Harappan civilization sites, groundwater resources, and geological data. Gain insights into its historical significance, potential location, and the ongoing debate about its disappearance. This platform fosters exploration and understanding of this intriguing piece of Indian history.

Bhuvan's web viewer opens a window to explore India's diverse landscapes via interactive maps. Choose from satellite imagery, forest cover, administrative boundaries, and more to customize your view. Dive into specific regions with features like satellite data downloads, terrain measurements, and even information on points of interest like monuments and protected areas. Whether you're a curious explorer, researcher, or citizen planner, Bhuvan empowers you to navigate and understand India's vast geographical tapestry.

The Ministry of Women & Child Development's Anganwadi platform, accessible through Bhuvan, provides a user-friendly interface for managing and visualizing field data related to Anganwadi centers. Users can log in and input a city name or latitude and longitude coordinates to access specific information. The tools available include the Field Data Viewer, allowing users to filter data by state, district, project, sector, AWCS (Anganwadi Centers), and AWWS (Anganwadi Worker and Supervisor). The platform's versatility is emphasized with the option to search by Anganwadi code for targeted inquiries. The geographic scope of 500 km on Bhuvan ensures comprehensive coverage. Users can also engage in discussions through the Discussion Forum, send mail, and access legends for better interpretation. The platform encourages collaboration and communication, fostering a supportive community within the Bhuvan environment.
Has all the information about the active, recovered and disease corona virus patients. This website has this information for all the states

Bhuvan MOEF CRIS dives deep into India's environmental conservation efforts. Explore a centralized resource inventory across various centers through detailed information and location maps. Analyze data on pollution control boards, wildlife sanctuaries, zoos, and botanical gardens. Access reports, monitor pollution levels, and even track greening initiatives. This platform empowers you to understand and engage in India's environmental journey. The Centralised Resource Inventory System (CRIS) by the Ministry of Environment, Forest, and Climate Change is a comprehensive platform facilitating resource management. Users can input a city or geographical coordinates to access information on various entities, including Autonomous Bodies, Centres of Excellence, ENVIS Centres, Focal Points, Institutes, Ministries, Public Sector Undertakings, and Regional Offices. The system categorizes resources under different branches such as Regional Centre for Botanical Survey of India (BSI), Regional Centre for Zoological Survey of India (ZSI), Regional Office for Forest Survey of India (FSI), Regional Office for Wildlife Crime Control Bureau (WCCB), and Regional Centre for National Afforestation and Eco-Development Board (NAEB). The left panel allows users to toggle visibility for a more focused view. Overall, CRIS serves as a centralized hub for managing and accessing environmental and forestry-related information.

Bhuvan Store offers a treasure trove of satellite data for India. Download high-resolution imagery from various satellites like Cartosat and Resourcesat. Access data covering terrain, land cover, vegetation, and water bodies across different resolutions and time periods. Bhuvan Store empowers researchers, planners, and anyone interested in India's diverse landscape to analyze and visualize geospatial data for their specific needs.

Bhuvan RBI - To Support RBI for mapping and effective management for all banks in India. Geotagging initiative is taken up using an android app to precisely locate RBI various banking units like Branch/ATMs/Administrative Office/Electronic Kiosk etc,. through Bhuvan Geoportal. Portal provides facility to visualise asset spread in the context of high resolution image backdrop with GIS analytical capabilities. This mapping system is a collaborative effort between Reserve Bank of India and National Remote Sensing Center, ISRO.

Bhuvan provides a plethora of tools and information across India through various portals. Explore diverse landscapes with interactive maps, from state viewers and specific regions like Himachal Pradesh forests to thematic data on land use and disaster management. Track fires, analyze climate impacts, visualize infrastructure, and delve into historical data. Bhuvan caters to everyone, from casual explorers to researchers and government officials, empowering them to understand and manage India's land, resources, and natural wonders. It is basically a geo governance platform.

School Bhuvan is a web portal developed by ISRO in collaboration with the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) in India. It offers interactive map-based learning experiences to enhance students' understanding of geography, natural resources, environmental issues, and sustainable development. Key features include: Interactive Maps: Explore maps of India with layers like satellite imagery, political boundaries, natural features, and thematic data. Level-Based Activities: Engage in exercises and tasks tailored to different levels of understanding, from basic map literacy to advanced spatial analysis. Curriculum Alignment: Resources and activities align with NCERT's curriculum for geography and environmental education. Air Quality Mapping: Explore interactive maps showcasing air quality data in Delhi, enabling students to visualize pollution patterns and understand its impact. Teacher Resources: Access lesson plans, teaching guides, and other resources to support educators in integrating geospatial technology into their classrooms. School Bhuvan aims to foster spatial thinking, environmental awareness, and informed decision-making among students, empowering them to become responsible citizens in a rapidly changing world.

Amritsar, historically known as Ramdaspur and colloquially as Ambarsar, stands as a significant city in the north-western part of India. Serving as the spiritual center for the Sikh religion, it also holds the administrative headquarters of the Amritsar district in Punjab. The city boasts a rich cultural and historical heritage, featuring renowned sites such as the iconic Golden Temple within the Harmandir Sahib Complex, the solemn Jalianwala Bagh, and various other religious landmarks like Gurudwaras and mosques. Amritsar offers diverse accommodation options, including Dharamshalas, Guest Houses, Hotels, and more. Visitors can explore not only religious and historical sites but also indulge in culinary delights at eateries, restaurants, and traditional Dhabas. Essential services like police stations, post offices, and healthcare facilities are well-integrated into the city, ensuring a convenient and enriching experience for tourists. The city's vibrant atmosphere, cultural significance, and architectural wonders make it a compelling destination for travelers seeking a blend of spirituality and heritage.

The Ludhiana Municipal Geographic Information System (GIS) on Bhuvan presents updated data for Block-27 of Zone – D, enhancing accessibility and information for residents and administrators. This platform offers a comprehensive view of municipal amenities, including banks, bus stands, cinemas, clubs, educational institutions, community centers, cremation/burial grounds, warehouses, municipal offices/residences, railway stations, and stadiums. The GIS tool provides residents with the ability to search for information using criteria such as ward, zone, block, locality, or house number, thereby enabling them to access details about specific areas within Ludhiana, Punjab. It serves as a valuable resource for citizens to understand ward-wise facilities, government schemes, and the grievance redressal system. The Ludhiana Municipal GIS on Bhuvan stands as a pivotal online planning tool, fostering better governance by facilitating administrators and planners in their decision-making processes.

Navigate India's highways with ease using Bhuvan Toll! Explore interactive maps showcasing national and state highways, overlaid with toll plaza locations and toll fee details. Plan your route ahead, estimate travel costs, and avoid surprises at the booth. This platform empowers drivers and travelers to optimize their journeys on India's vast network of toll roads.
Webpage contains a lot information about baselin studies on water use efficiency of irrigation projects

Bhuvan Mines delves into the world of mineral resources in India. Explore interactive maps showcasing mine locations across states, overlaid with data on minerals extracted, lease details, and production statistics. Access reports, visualize mining trends, and even identify potential new sites. This platform empowers policymakers, researchers, and anyone interested in India's mineral wealth to understand and analyze the mining landscape.

Bhuvan Agriculture serves as your India-wide farmhand, empowering you to explore and understand the agricultural landscape. Navigate detailed maps layered with land cover, water resources, irrigation networks, and even crop type. Track soil health, monitor droughts, and analyze agricultural trends. Access detailed information on agricultural schemes, markets, and research facilities. Bhuvan Agriculture empowers farmers, researchers, and anyone interested in India's food security to cultivate knowledge and manage resources for a thriving agricultural future.

Dive into the fertile deltas of India with Bhuvan! Explore interactive maps showcasing the landforms, vegetation, and administrative boundaries of these vital ecosystems. Choose from the Mahanadi and Sunderbans deltas, and access detailed information on their hydrology, infrastructure, and conservation efforts. Track sediment flow, analyze land use patterns, and even contribute your own experiences. Bhuvan Deltas empowers you to explore, understand, and advocate for the sustainable future of these irreplaceable natural treasures.

Bhuvan CDMA unlocks a detailed view of property tax data in Telangana. Explore interactive maps overlaid with satellite imagery, administrative boundaries, and property locations. Search by assessment number or district to access specific property details like type, area, and tax assessments. Monitor notifications, download data, and even get directions to specific locations. Bhuvan CDMA streamlines property tax management for authorities and empowers citizens to access information about their own valuable properties.

This is a shipping related website of BHUVAN. It uses Central Authentication Services and Single Sign In Options to login and use the features.

The Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY), a flagship scheme of the Department of Agriculture, Cooperation, and Farmers Welfare under the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, has played a crucial role in driving and sustaining the growth of agriculture and allied sectors during the 11th and 12th Five Year plan periods. With over 12,000 projects sanctioned by states under RKVY, many of which involve infrastructure and asset creation, the initiative has taken a significant step forward through the implementation of Geo-tagging using Bhuvan Geoportal Technologies. This involves the use of an Android app to precisely locate RKVY assets. The Geoportal not only facilitates the visualization of asset distribution against a high-resolution image backdrop but also incorporates GIS analytical capabilities. This advancement aims to enhance the precision and management of RKVY projects by utilizing modern geospatial technologies for effective monitoring and decision-making. The integration of Geo-tagging through Bhuvan Geoportal reflects a commitment to leveraging technology for optimizing the impact and efficiency of agricultural development initiatives.

Bhuvan AIBP sheds light on India's irrigation project landscape. Explore interactive maps showcasing project locations across states, overlaid with data on project details, funding, and progress. Dive into reports, monitor project implementation, and track water flow through canals and reservoirs. This platform empowers government officials, researchers, and anyone interested in India's water security to analyze irrigation efforts and ensure the efficient distribution of this vital resource.

Bhuvan's MWRDS portal delves into India's water sector, weaving a tapestry of information through interactive maps and detailed reports. Navigate satellite imagery overlaid with water bodies, infrastructure, and administrative boundaries. Dive into specific watersheds, analyzing parameters like groundwater levels, irrigation networks, and water use patterns. Track progress of Integrated Watershed Management programs, access relevant datasets, and even contribute your own knowledge. Whether you're a policymaker, researcher, or concerned citizen, Bhuvan MWRDS empowers you to explore, understand, and contribute to managing this vital resource in a sustainable way.

Bhuvan PMGSY takes you on a journey through India's rural roads, mapping the progress of the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana. Navigate interactive maps showcasing completed and ongoing road projects, overlaid with satellite imagery and administrative boundaries. Track construction progress, measure distances, and access detailed project information like length, cost, and beneficiary villages. Bhuvan PMGSY empowers you to witness the transformation of rural India, connecting remote communities and paving the way for increased development.

Bhuvan collaborates with diverse agencies to enrich its platform with local expertise. From tourism boards sharing information on scenic spots to forest departments tracking wildlife and managing resources, each collaboration unlocks a new layer of understanding about India's landscapes and infrastructure. This network empowers Bhuvan to offer a comprehensive and ever-evolving view of the nation, promoting informed decision-making and sustainable development.
